medical_history.chief_complaint: Left breast cancer detected at screening.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 65-year-old man, had a history of right breast cancer diagnosed 2 years prior to the current presentation. During his second annual mammographic examination, an 8-mm nonpalpable mass was detected in the left breast, which was later confirmed as infiltrating ductal carcinoma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Prior diagnosis of 1.5-cm infiltrating ductal carcinoma of the right breast, treated with mastectomy and chemotherapy. History of estrogen and progesterone receptor positive tumor and BRCA2 mutation.
medical_history.family_history: None of the patientâ€™s five siblings and neither parent had a history of breast cancer.
